turns.content:
how can I market below training curriculum in series of social media posts which will convince trainees to purchase the E&M training workshop

• Introduction to 2023 Guidelines.
• History of E/M MDM table from 1995 to 2023 changes Overview
• Types of MDM table
• Detailed discussion on Data points - Amount and/or Complexity of Data to Be Reviewed and Analysed
• New changes in Hospital coding (observation, Inpatient & consultation Services)
• Time based coding concepts – Total Time
• Prolonged Services
• How the new MDM table applies to ED coding.
• ED Examples 
• How the New MDM table applies to Hospital observation & Inpatient coding.
• OBS & IP Examples
• FAQs

Here are a few suggestions for marketing the E&M training workshop on social media:

1. Create a teaser post announcing the upcoming workshop and highlighting the key topics that will be covered, such as an introduction to the 2023 guidelines and a detailed discussion on data points.
2. Share a post that provides a brief history of the E/M MDM table and how it has evolved over the years, emphasizing the changes that will be discussed in the workshop.
3. Share a post that focuses on one of the specific topics that will be covered in the workshop, such as hospital coding for observation, inpatient, and consultation services.
4. Share a post that highlights the practical applications of the workshop, such as how the new MDM table applies to ED coding and hospital observation and inpatient coding.
5. Share a post that addresses any frequently asked questions that potential trainees may have about the workshop.

It's also important to include a call to action in each post, such as a link to register for the workshop or a promotional code for a discounted rate.
Create a teaser post announcing the upcoming workshop and highlighting the key topics that will be covered, such as an introduction to the 2023 guidelines and a detailed discussion on data points.

"Attention all healthcare professionals! Are you ready to stay ahead of the game in E&M coding? Our upcoming workshop is a must-attend event for anyone looking to stay current with the latest guidelines. Join us as we delve into the 2023 updates and give you a detailed understanding of data points. Don't miss out on this opportunity to enhance your coding skills and stay compliant. Register now and secure your spot! #EandM #Coding #2023Guidelines"

Create a teaser post announcing the upcoming workshop and highlighting the key topics that will be covered, such as an introduction to the 2023 guidelines and a detailed discussion on data points.

Create it in most emotional and convincing manner

"Calling all healthcare professionals! Are you tired of feeling unsure about E&M coding? Are you tired of worrying about compliance? Our upcoming workshop is here to change that! Join us as we guide you through the latest 2023 guidelines and give you a thorough understanding of data points. Don't miss out on this chance to empower yourself with the knowledge and skills you need to excel in your field. Register now and take the first step towards coding confidence! #EandM #Coding #2023Guidelines"
Share a post that provides a brief history of the E/M MDM table and how it has evolved over the years, emphasizing the changes that will be discussed in the workshop.

"Do you know the story behind the E/M MDM table? It's evolution over the years is fascinating! From 1995 to 2023 the MDM table has undergone significant changes.
In our upcoming workshop, we will take a deep dive into the history of the E/M MDM table, and discuss the changes that have been made over the years and how it will affect your coding practices. Don't miss this opportunity to gain valuable insights and stay current with the latest developments. Register now to save your seat! #EandM #Coding #MDMtable"

Share a post that addresses any frequently asked questions that potential trainees may have about the workshop.

"Are you curious about our upcoming workshop but have some questions? We've got you covered! Here are some frequently asked questions:
Q: Who is this workshop for?
A: This workshop is for healthcare professionals who want to stay current with the latest E&M coding guidelines.

Q: What topics will be covered in the workshop?
A: The workshop will cover an introduction to the 2023 guidelines, history of the E/M MDM table, detailed discussion on data points, new changes in hospital coding and more.

Q: Will there be any hands-on practice?
A: Yes, the workshop will include practical examples and case studies to help you apply what you've learned.

Q: How long is the workshop?
A: The workshop is 2 days long

Don't see your question here? Feel free to reach out to us for more information. Register now and secure your spot! #EandM #Coding #FAQ"
